comments.body:
I am _none_ to happy about using eval, but this is the only way I found to successfully parse this output bacK

```bash
$ (trap "echo 'exit 123'" EXIT; trap -p EXIT;)
+> trap 'echo '\''exit 123'\''' EXIT
+> trap -p EXIT
trap -- 'echo '\''exit 123'\''' EXIT
++> echo 'exit 123'
exit 123
```

PTAL @potiuk

Yeah. It is insane. I agree. 

Indeed I forgot about cleaning the volume in CI when we separated  it out (it's implemented in Breeze). Would be worth checking if test failure results with exit != 0. I hope it will fail randomly so we would know ;)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +42,46 @@  local signal="$1"
  # Yes, eval is evil, but this is the only way I was able to "parse" the output of trap which is "already" quoted
  eval "set -- $(trap -p "$signal")"
  # Output format is `trap -- 'command' <signal>`
  echo "${3-}"
